candidates.definition: Formal written works that have been officially released or distributed through established publishing channels.

positive_examples: The novel was published by Random House last year.
She cited several academic articles in her research paper.
The military manual contains official joint doctrine procedures.
This encyclopedia series covers world history comprehensively.
The Chairman's publication outlined new strategic guidelines.
The magazine article discussed climate change impacts.
negative_examples: He wrote a quick email to his colleague.
She jotted down notes in her personal diary.
The draft manuscript sits unfinished on his desk.
They exchanged text messages about dinner plans.
The handwritten letter was never sent.
His blog post was just a rough outline.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: PersonalWriting, CommunicationMessages, DraftDocuments, InformalText

candidates.definition: Text content created for or associated with audio-visual media formats like recordings, films, and music.

positive_examples: The movie script contained detailed dialogue for each scene.
She wrote beautiful lyrics for the new pop song.
The documentary's narration text was carefully crafted.
The album liner notes included all the song lyrics.
The film's subtitle file contained translations in multiple languages.
The podcast transcript captured every word of the interview.
negative_examples: The novel was published in hardcover last year.
She wrote a research paper on climate change.
The newspaper article covered local politics.
He sent a text message to his friend.
The instruction manual explained how to use the device.
The legal contract required careful review.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: LiteraryText, TechnicalDocumentation, NewsText, AcademicText

candidates.definition: Official texts with legal, institutional, or procedural authority that require specific formatting and serve formal purposes.

positive_examples: The marriage certificate was signed by both parties and the officiant.
The peace treaty between the two nations was ratified by both parliaments.
The doctor wrote a prescription for antibiotics to treat the infection.
Please fill out this tax form completely before submitting it to the IRS.
The military doctrine clearly outlines rules of engagement for peacekeeping missions.
The birth certificate serves as official proof of citizenship.
negative_examples: She wrote a heartfelt letter to her grandmother about her travels.
The newspaper article discussed the recent political developments.
He sent a casual email to his colleague about the meeting time.
The novel's opening chapter captivated readers with its vivid imagery.
The shopping list included milk, bread, and fresh vegetables.
Her diary entry reflected on the day's meaningful conversations.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: Literature, Correspondence, News, Instructions, Reference

candidates.definition: Categories or types of written works distinguished by their style, content, or purpose

positive_examples: This book falls into the mystery genre with its detective storyline
She prefers reading romance novels over science fiction
The documentary represents factual reporting rather than entertainment
Biblical gospels constitute a unique genre of religious literature
Poetry and prose are two different literary forms
Historical accounts differ from mythological narratives in their approach
negative_examples: The book was written in English rather than French
This text uses a 12-point font size
The manuscript contains 300 pages of content
The document was printed on high-quality paper
She read the text aloud to the audience
The author's writing style is very engaging
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TextFormat, TextLength, TextLanguage, TextStyle, TextMedium

candidates.definition: The organizational elements and formatting components that give shape and hierarchy to written content.

positive_examples: The essay was well-organized with clear paragraphs and smooth transitions between ideas.
This document uses headings and bullet points to structure the information effectively.
The abstract provides a concise summary of the research findings.
Each section label helps readers navigate through the technical manual.
The outline shows how the main arguments flow from introduction to conclusion.
File names should include descriptive labels like .pdf or .docx extensions.
negative_examples: The author's writing style was eloquent and persuasive throughout.
This novel contains several interesting characters and plot twists.
The vocabulary used in this text is quite advanced and technical.
The font size and color scheme make this document easy to read.
The paper explores fascinating themes about human nature.
This book was published by Oxford University Press in 2023.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: TextContent, TextStyle, TextGenre, TextQuality

candidates.definition: Streams of textual content that are automatically updated and organized for users to consume in sequence.

positive_examples: I scrolled through my Twitter timeline to see the latest posts from people I follow.
The RSS feed automatically updates with new blog articles from my favorite websites.
She checked her Instagram feed to see what her friends had been posting today.
The live blog provided continuous updates about the breaking news story.
My LinkedIn feed shows professional updates and articles from my network.
The forum's recent posts feed helps me stay current with ongoing discussions.
negative_examples: I read the entire newspaper from front to back this morning.
She wrote a detailed blog post about her vacation experiences.
The book contained fascinating stories about ancient civilizations.
He sent me a long email explaining the project requirements.
The magazine article discussed climate change in great detail.
I printed out the research paper to read it more carefully.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: StaticText, DocumentText, MessageText, ArticleText
